title: Reducers need to provide default value, even when using preloadedState
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**  
Bug/unexpected behavior


**What is the current behavior?**
When the store is created, and an initial `preloadedState` is provided, reducers are called with the `@@redux/INIT` action and an `undefined` state. This causes startup to fail, unless the reducers provide default values for state. [Here's a codepen](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/yMrLzg?editors=0010) which replicates the issue.

**What is the expected behavior?**
When providing a `preloadedState`, I would expect to not need to provide a default value in my reducer, since I've already provided one in the form of `preloadedState`. I understand that this is to ensure that reducers are properly-written, in that they don't return `undefined` even when passed `undefined`. However, if a field in the store is populated using `preloadedState` and never changed, it seems silly to have to do either:

```javascript
const propReducer = (state = null, action) => state
```
or

```javascript
const preloadedState = window['__PRELOADED_STATE__']
const propReducer = (state = preloadedState.prop, action) => state
```

At the very least, I think the documentation for using preloaded state should be updated to include this, because it wasn't entirely obvious (without reading the redux source code) why I needed to provide this default when, in my mind, I already had.

**Which versions of Redux, and which browser and OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of Redux?**
The browser/OS/version aren't really relevant, since the unexpected behavior will occur in any scenario.
